<h2 id="resources">Resources</h2>
<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ComputeCluster" data-link-title="ComputeCluster">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L112">
        Resource <strong>ComputeCluster</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ComputeCluster</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

> **A note on the naming of this resource:** VMware refers to clusters of
hosts in the UI and documentation as _clusters_, _HA clusters_, or _DRS
clusters_. All of these refer to the same kind of resource (with the latter two
referring to specific features of clustering). We use
`vsphere..ComputeCluster` to differentiate host clusters from _datastore
clusters_, which are clusters of datastores that can be used to distribute load
and ensure fault tolerance via distribution of virtual machines. Datastore
clusters can also be managed through the provider, via the
`vsphere..DatastoreCluster` resource.

The `vsphere..ComputeCluster` resource can be used to create and manage
clusters of hosts allowing for resource control of compute resources, load
balancing through DRS, and high availability through vSphere HA.

For more information on vSphere clusters and DRS, see [this
page][ref-vsphere-drs-clusters]. For more information on vSphere HA, see [this
page][ref-vsphere-ha-clusters].

[ref-vsphere-drs-clusters]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-8ACF3502-5314-469F-8CC9-4A9BD5925BC2.html
[ref-vsphere-ha-clusters]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.avail.doc/GUID-5432CA24-14F1-44E3-87FB-61D937831CF6.html

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** vSphere DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const datacenter = config.get("datacenter") || "dc1";
const hosts = config.get("hosts") || [
    "esxi1",
    "esxi2",
    "esxi3",
];

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: datacenter,
}, { async: true }));
const hostsHost: pulumi.Output<vsphere.GetHostResult>[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < hosts.length; i++) {
    hostsHost.push(dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getHost({
        datacenterId: dc.id,
        name: hosts[i],
    }, { async: true })));
}
const computeCluster = new vsphere.ComputeCluster("computeCluster", {
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    drsAutomationLevel: "fullyAutomated",
    drsEnabled: true,
    haEnabled: true,
    hostSystemIds: hostsHost.map(v => v.id),
});
```

#### vSphere Version Requirements

A large number of settings in the `vsphere..ComputeCluster` resource require a
specific version of vSphere to function. Rather than include warnings at every
setting or section, these settings are documented below.  Note that this list
is for cluster-specific attributes only, and does not include the
`tags` parameter, which requires vSphere 6.0 or higher across all
resources that can be tagged.

All settings are footnoted by an asterisk (`*`) in their specific section in
the documentation, which takes you here.

##### Settings that require vSphere version 6.0 or higher

These settings require vSphere 6.0 or higher:

* `haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction`
* `haDatastoreApdResponse`
* `haDatastoreApdResponseDelay`
* `haDatastorePdlResponse`
* `haVmComponentProtection`

##### Settings that require vSphere version 6.5 or higher

These settings require vSphere 6.5 or higher:

* `drsEnablePredictiveDrs`
* `haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance`
  (When `haAdmissionControlPolicy` is set to
  `resourcePercentage` or `slotPolicy`. Permitted in all versions under
  `failoverHosts`)
* `haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute`
* `haVmRestartTimeout`
* `haVmDependencyRestartCondition`
* `haVmRestartAdditionalDelay`
* `proactiveHaAutomationLevel`
* `proactiveHaEnabled`
* `proactiveHaModerateRemediation`
* `proactiveHaProviderIds`
* `proactiveHaSevereRemediation`

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-dpmAutomationLevel">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L154">property <b>dpmAutomationLevel</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>dpmAutomationLevel: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The automation level for host power
operations in this cluster. Can be one of `manual` or `automated`. Default:
`manual`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-dpmEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L160">property <b>dpmEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>dpmEnabled: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable DPM support for DRS in this cluster.
Requires `drsEnabled` to be `true` in order to be effective.
Default: `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-dpmThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L167">property <b>dpmThreshold</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>dpmThreshold: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A value between `1` and `5` indicating the
threshold of load within the cluster that influences host power operations.
This affects both power on and power off operations - a lower setting will
tolerate more of a surplus/deficit than a higher setting. Default: `3`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-drsAdvancedOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L172">property <b>drsAdvancedOptions</b></a>
</h4>

A key/value map that specifies advanced
options for DRS and DPM.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-drsAutomationLevel">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L178">property <b>drsAutomationLevel</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>drsAutomationLevel: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The default automation level for all
virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `manual`,
`partiallyAutomated`, or `fullyAutomated`. Default: `manual`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-drsEnablePredictiveDrs">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L184">property <b>drsEnablePredictiveDrs</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>drsEnablePredictiveDrs: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

When `true`, enables DRS to use data
from [vRealize Operations Manager][ref-vsphere-vro] to make proactive DRS
recommendations. <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-drsEnableVmOverrides">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L189">property <b>drsEnableVmOverrides</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>drsEnableVmOverrides: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Allow individual DRS overrides to be
set for virtual machines in the cluster. Default: `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-drsEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L193">property <b>drsEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>drsEnabled: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable DRS for this cluster. Default: `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-drsMigrationThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L200">property <b>drsMigrationThreshold</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>drsMigrationThreshold: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A value between `1` and `5` indicating
the threshold of imbalance tolerated between hosts. A lower setting will
tolerate more imbalance while a higher setting will tolerate less. Default:
`3`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-folder">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L209">property <b>folder</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>folder: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The relative path to a folder to put this cluster in.
This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the cluster to.
Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of `foo/bar`,
The provider will place a cluster named `compute-cluster-test` in a
host folder located at `/dc1/host/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path
being `/dc1/host/foo/bar/datastore-cluster-test`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-forceEvacuateOnDestroy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L217">property <b>forceEvacuateOnDestroy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>forceEvacuateOnDestroy: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

When destroying the resource, setting this to
`true` will auto-remove any hosts that are currently a member of the cluster,
as if they were removed by taking their entry out of `hostSystemIds` (see
below). This is an advanced
option and should only be used for testing. Default: `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L225">property <b>haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>[] | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Defines the
managed object IDs of hosts to use as dedicated failover
hosts. These hosts are kept as available as possible - admission control will
block access to the host, and DRS will ignore the host when making
recommendations.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L233">property <b>haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum number
of failed hosts that admission control tolerates when making decisions on
whether to permit virtual machine operations. The maximum is one less than
the number of hosts in the cluster. Default: `1`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L240">property <b>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The percentage of
resource reduction that a cluster of virtual machines can tolerate in case of
a failover. A value of 0 produces warnings only, whereas a value of 100
disables the setting. Default: `100` (disabled).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L246">property <b>haAdmissionControlPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlPolicy: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of admission control
policy to use with vSphere HA. Can be one of `resourcePercentage`,
`slotPolicy`, `failoverHosts`, or `disabled`. Default: `resourcePercentage`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L256">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Automatically determine available resource percentages by subtracting the
average number of host resources represented by the
`haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance`
setting from the total amount of resources in the cluster. Disable to supply
user-defined values. Default: `true`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L262">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of CPU resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L268">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of memory resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L273">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined CPU slot size, in MHz. Default: `32`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L278">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined memory slot size, in MB. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L285">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls
whether or not you wish to supply explicit values to CPU and memory slot
sizes. The default is `false`, which tells vSphere to gather a automatic

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haAdvancedOptions: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>} | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A key/value map that specifies advanced
options for vSphere HA.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L297">property <b>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take
on virtual machines if an APD status on an affected datastore clears in the
middle of an APD event. Can be one of `none` or `reset`. Default: `none`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haDatastoreApdResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L305">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haDatastoreApdResponse: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected loss to all paths to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`,
`restartConservative`, or `restartAggressive`.  Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haDatastoreApdResponseDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L312">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the delay in minutes
to wait after an APD timeout event to execute the response action defined in
`haDatastoreApdResponse`. Default: `3`
minutes. <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haDatastorePdlResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L320">property <b>haDatastorePdlResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haDatastorePdlResponse: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected a permanent device loss to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`, or
`restartAggressive`. Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L325">property <b>haEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haEnabled: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable vSphere HA for this cluster. Default:
`false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haHeartbeatDatastoreIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L332">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>[] | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The list of managed object IDs for
preferred datastores to use for HA heartbeating. This setting is only useful
when `haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy` is set
to either `userSelectedDs` or `allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L339">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The selection policy for HA
heartbeat datastores. Can be one of `allFeasibleDs`, `userSelectedDs`, or
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`. Default:
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haHostIsolationResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L346">property <b>haHostIsolationResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haHostIsolationResponse: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The action to take on virtual
machines when a host has detected that it has been isolated from the rest of
the cluster. Can be one of `none`, `powerOff`, or `shutdown`. Default:
`none`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haHostMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L352">property <b>haHostMonitoring</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haHostMonitoring: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Global setting that controls whether
vSphere HA remediates virtual machines on host failure. Can be one of `enabled`
or `disabled`. Default: `enabled`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmComponentProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L359">property <b>haVmComponentProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmComponentProtection: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls vSphere VM component
protection for virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `enabled` or
`disabled`. Default: `enabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmDependencyRestartCondition">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L369">property <b>haVmDependencyRestartCondition</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmDependencyRestartCondition: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The condition used to
determine whether or not virtual machines in a certain restart priority class
are online, allowing HA to move on to restarting virtual machines on the next
priority. Can be one of `none`, `poweredOn`, `guestHbStatusGreen`, or
`appHbStatusGreen`. The default is `none`, which means that a virtual machine
is considered ready immediately after a host is found to start it on.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmFailureInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L375">property <b>haVmFailureInterval</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmFailureInterval: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If a heartbeat from a virtual machine
is not received within this configured interval, the virtual machine is
marked as failed. The value is in seconds. Default: `30`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmMaximumFailureWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L384">property <b>haVmMaximumFailureWindow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmMaximumFailureWindow: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The length of the reset window in
which `haVmMaximumResets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting
configured in `haVmMaximumResets`. `-1` means no window, meaning an
unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:
`-1` (no window).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmMaximumResets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L389">property <b>haVmMaximumResets</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmMaximumResets: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum number of resets that HA will
perform to a virtual machine when responding to a failure event. Default: `3`

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmMinimumUptime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L395">property <b>haVmMinimumUptime</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmMinimumUptime: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The time, in seconds, that HA waits after
powering on a virtual machine before monitoring for heartbeats. Default:
`120` (2 minutes).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L401">property <b>haVmMonitoring</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmMonitoring: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of virtual machine monitoring to use
when HA is enabled in the cluster. Can be one of `vmMonitoringDisabled`,
`vmMonitoringOnly`, or `vmAndAppMonitoring`. Default: `vmMonitoringDisabled`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmRestartAdditionalDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L407">property <b>haVmRestartAdditionalDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmRestartAdditionalDelay: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Additional delay in seconds
after ready condition is met. A VM is considered ready at this point.
Default: `0` (no delay). <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmRestartPriority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L413">property <b>haVmRestartPriority</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmRestartPriority: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The default restart priority
for affected virtual machines when vSphere detects a host failure. Can be one
of `lowest`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `highest`. Default: `medium`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-haVmRestartTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L420">property <b>haVmRestartTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>haVmRestartTimeout: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum time, in seconds,
that vSphere HA will wait for virtual machines in one priority to be ready
before proceeding with the next priority. Default: `600` (10 minutes).
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-hostClusterExitTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L426">property <b>hostClusterExitTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>hostClusterExitTimeout: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The timeout for each host maintenance mode
operation when removing hosts from a cluster. The value is specified in
seconds. Default: `3600` (1 hour).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-hostSystemIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L431">property <b>hostSystemIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>hostSystemIds: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>[] | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The managed object IDs of
the hosts to put in the cluster.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-id">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L112">property <b>id</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>id: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>Output</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#ID'>ID</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.  It is set during
deployments and may be missing (undefined) during planning phases.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L435">property <b>name</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>name: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The name of the cluster.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-proactiveHaAutomationLevel">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L442">property <b>proactiveHaAutomationLevel</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>proactiveHaAutomationLevel: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Determines how the host
quarantine, maintenance mode, or virtual machine migration recommendations
made by proactive HA are to be handled. Can be one of `Automated` or

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeCluster-proactiveHaEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L447">property <b>proactiveHaEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>proactiveHaEnabled: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enables Proactive HA. Default: `false`.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ComputeClusterHostGroup" data-link-title="ComputeClusterHostGroup">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeClusterHostGroup.ts#L65">
        Resource <strong>ComputeClusterHostGroup</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ComputeClusterHostGroup</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..ComputeClusterHostGroup` resource can be used to manage groups
of hosts in a cluster, either created by the
`vsphere..ComputeCluster` resource or looked up
by the `vsphere..ComputeCluster` data source.

This resource mainly serves as an input to the
`vsphere..ComputeClusterVmHostRule`
resource - see the documentation for that resource for further details on how
to use host groups.

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** vSphere DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const datacenter = config.get("datacenter") || "dc1";
const hosts = config.get("hosts") || [
    "esxi1",
    "esxi2",
    "esxi3",
];

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: datacenter,
}, { async: true }));
const hostsHost: pulumi.Output<vsphere.GetHostResult>[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < hosts.length; i++) {
    hostsHost.push(dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getHost({
        datacenterId: dc.id,
        name: hosts[i],
    }, { async: true })));
}
const computeCluster = new vsphere.ComputeCluster("computeCluster", {
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    drsAutomationLevel: "fullyAutomated",
    drsEnabled: true,
    haEnabled: true,
    hostSystemIds: hostsHost.map(v => v.id),
});
const clusterHostGroup = new vsphere.ComputeClusterHostGroup("clusterHostGroup", {
    computeClusterId: computeCluster.id,
    hostSystemIds: hostsHost.map(v => v.id),
});
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/r/compute_cluster_host_group.html.markdown.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ComputeClusterVmAffinityRule" data-link-title="ComputeClusterVmAffinityRule">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeClusterVmAffinityRule.ts#L78">
        Resource <strong>ComputeClusterVmAffinityRule</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ComputeClusterVmAffinityRule</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..ComputeClusterVmAffinityRule` resource can be used to manage
VM affinity rules in a cluster, either created by the
`vsphere..ComputeCluster` resource or looked up
by the `vsphere..ComputeCluster` data source.

This rule can be used to tell a set to virtual machines to run together on a
single host within a cluster. When configured, DRS will make a best effort to
ensure that the virtual machines run on the same host, or prevent any operation
that would keep that from happening, depending on the value of the
`mandatory` flag.

> Keep in mind that this rule can only be used to tell VMs to run together on
a _non-specific_ host - it can't be used to pin VMs to a host. For that, see
the
`vsphere..ComputeClusterVmHostRule`
resource.

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** vSphere DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const datastore = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getDatastore({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "datastore1",
}, { async: true }));
const cluster = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getComputeCluster({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "cluster1",
}, { async: true }));
const network = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getNetwork({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "network1",
}, { async: true }));
const vm: vsphere.VirtualMachine[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
    vm.push(new vsphere.VirtualMachine(`vm-${i}`, {
        datastoreId: datastore.id,
        disks: [{
            label: "disk0",
            size: 20,
        }],
        guestId: "other3xLinux64Guest",
        memory: 2048,
        networkInterfaces: [{
            networkId: network.id,
        }],
        numCpus: 2,
        resourcePoolId: cluster.resourcePoolId,
    }));
}
const clusterVmAffinityRule = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmAffinityRule("clusterVmAffinityRule", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    virtualMachineIds: vm.map(v => v.id),
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ComputeClusterVmAntiAffinityRule" data-link-title="ComputeClusterVmAntiAffinityRule">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeClusterVmAntiAffinityRule.ts#L79">
        Resource <strong>ComputeClusterVmAntiAffinityRule</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ComputeClusterVmAntiAffinityRule</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..ComputeClusterVmAntiAffinityRule` resource can be used to
manage VM anti-affinity rules in a cluster, either created by the
`vsphere..ComputeCluster` resource or looked up
by the `vsphere..ComputeCluster` data source.

This rule can be used to tell a set to virtual machines to run on different
hosts within a cluster, useful for preventing single points of failure in
application cluster scenarios. When configured, DRS will make a best effort to
ensure that the virtual machines run on different hosts, or prevent any
operation that would keep that from happening, depending on the value of the
`mandatory` flag.

> Keep in mind that this rule can only be used to tell VMs to run separately
on _non-specific_ hosts - specific hosts cannot be specified with this rule.
For that, see the
`vsphere..ComputeClusterVmHostRule`
resource.

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** vSphere DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const datastore = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getDatastore({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "datastore1",
}, { async: true }));
const cluster = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getComputeCluster({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "cluster1",
}, { async: true }));
const network = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getNetwork({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "network1",
}, { async: true }));
const vm: vsphere.VirtualMachine[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
    vm.push(new vsphere.VirtualMachine(`vm-${i}`, {
        datastoreId: datastore.id,
        disks: [{
            label: "disk0",
            size: 20,
        }],
        guestId: "other3xLinux64Guest",
        memory: 2048,
        networkInterfaces: [{
            networkId: network.id,
        }],
        numCpus: 2,
        resourcePoolId: cluster.resourcePoolId,
    }));
}
const clusterVmAntiAffinityRule = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmAntiAffinityRule("clusterVmAntiAffinityRule", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    virtualMachineIds: vm.map(v => v.id),
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ComputeClusterVmDependencyRule" data-link-title="ComputeClusterVmDependencyRule">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeClusterVmDependencyRule.ts#L90">
        Resource <strong>ComputeClusterVmDependencyRule</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ComputeClusterVmDependencyRule</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..ComputeClusterVmDependencyRule` resource can be used to manage
VM dependency rules in a cluster, either created by the
`vsphere..ComputeCluster` resource or looked up
by the `vsphere..ComputeCluster` data source.

A virtual machine dependency rule applies to vSphere HA, and allows
user-defined startup orders for virtual machines in the case of host failure.
Virtual machines are supplied via groups, which can be managed via the
`vsphere..ComputeClusterVmGroup`
resource.

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const datastore = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getDatastore({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "datastore1",
}, { async: true }));
const cluster = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getComputeCluster({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "cluster1",
}, { async: true }));
const network = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getNetwork({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "network1",
}, { async: true }));
const vm1 = new vsphere.VirtualMachine("vm1", {
    datastoreId: datastore.id,
    disks: [{
        label: "disk0",
        size: 20,
    }],
    guestId: "other3xLinux64Guest",
    memory: 2048,
    networkInterfaces: [{
        networkId: network.id,
    }],
    numCpus: 2,
    resourcePoolId: cluster.resourcePoolId,
});
const vm2 = new vsphere.VirtualMachine("vm2", {
    datastoreId: datastore.id,
    disks: [{
        label: "disk0",
        size: 20,
    }],
    guestId: "other3xLinux64Guest",
    memory: 2048,
    networkInterfaces: [{
        networkId: network.id,
    }],
    numCpus: 2,
    resourcePoolId: cluster.resourcePoolId,
});
const clusterVmGroup1 = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmGroup("clusterVmGroup1", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    virtualMachineIds: [vm1.id],
});
const clusterVmGroup2 = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmGroup("clusterVmGroup2", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    virtualMachineIds: [vm2.id],
});
const clusterVmDependencyRule = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmDependencyRule("clusterVmDependencyRule", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    dependencyVmGroupName: clusterVmGroup1.name,
    vmGroupName: clusterVmGroup2.name,
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ComputeClusterVmGroup" data-link-title="ComputeClusterVmGroup">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeClusterVmGroup.ts#L78">
        Resource <strong>ComputeClusterVmGroup</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ComputeClusterVmGroup</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..ComputeClusterVmGroup` resource can be used to manage groups of
virtual machines in a cluster, either created by the
[`vsphere..ComputeCluster`][tf-vsphere-cluster-resource] resource or looked up
by the [`vsphere..ComputeCluster`][tf-vsphere-cluster-data-source] data source.

[tf-vsphere-cluster-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/compute_cluster.html
[tf-vsphere-cluster-data-source]: /docs/providers/vsphere/d/compute_cluster.html

This resource mainly serves as an input to the
[`vsphere..ComputeClusterVmDependencyRule`][tf-vsphere-cluster-vm-dependency-rule-resource]
and
[`vsphere..ComputeClusterVmHostRule`][tf-vsphere-cluster-vm-host-rule-resource]
resources. See the individual resource documentation pages for more information.

[tf-vsphere-cluster-vm-dependency-rule-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/compute_cluster_vm_dependency_rule.html
[tf-vsphere-cluster-vm-host-rule-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/compute_cluster_vm_host_rule.html

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** vSphere DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const datastore = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getDatastore({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "datastore1",
}, { async: true }));
const cluster = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getComputeCluster({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "cluster1",
}, { async: true }));
const network = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getNetwork({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "network1",
}, { async: true }));
const vm: vsphere.VirtualMachine[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
    vm.push(new vsphere.VirtualMachine(`vm-${i}`, {
        datastoreId: datastore.id,
        disks: [{
            label: "disk0",
            size: 20,
        }],
        guestId: "other3xLinux64Guest",
        memory: 2048,
        networkInterfaces: [{
            networkId: network.id,
        }],
        numCpus: 2,
        resourcePoolId: cluster.resourcePoolId,
    }));
}
const clusterVmGroup = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmGroup("clusterVmGroup", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    virtualMachineIds: vm.map(v => v.id),
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ComputeClusterVmHostRule" data-link-title="ComputeClusterVmHostRule">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeClusterVmHostRule.ts#L84">
        Resource <strong>ComputeClusterVmHostRule</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ComputeClusterVmHostRule</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..ComputeClusterVmHostRule` resource can be used to manage
VM-to-host rules in a cluster, either created by the
`vsphere..ComputeCluster` resource or looked up
by the `vsphere..ComputeCluster` data source.

This resource can create both _affinity rules_, where virtual machines run on
specified hosts, or _anti-affinity_ rules, where virtual machines run on hosts
outside of the ones specified in the rule. Virtual machines and hosts are
supplied via groups, which can be managed via the
`vsphere..ComputeClusterVmGroup` and
`vsphere..ComputeClusterHostGroup`
resources.

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** vSphere DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const datastore = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getDatastore({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "datastore1",
}, { async: true }));
const cluster = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getComputeCluster({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "cluster1",
}, { async: true }));
const host = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getHost({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "esxi1",
}, { async: true }));
const network = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getNetwork({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "network1",
}, { async: true }));
const vm = new vsphere.VirtualMachine("vm", {
    datastoreId: datastore.id,
    disks: [{
        label: "disk0",
        size: 20,
    }],
    guestId: "other3xLinux64Guest",
    memory: 2048,
    networkInterfaces: [{
        networkId: network.id,
    }],
    numCpus: 2,
    resourcePoolId: cluster.resourcePoolId,
});
const clusterVmGroup = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmGroup("clusterVmGroup", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    virtualMachineIds: [vm.id],
});
const clusterHostGroup = new vsphere.ComputeClusterHostGroup("clusterHostGroup", {
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    hostSystemIds: [host.id],
});
const clusterVmHostRule = new vsphere.ComputeClusterVmHostRule("clusterVmHostRule", {
    affinityHostGroupName: clusterHostGroup.name,
    computeClusterId: cluster.id,
    vmGroupName: clusterVmGroup.name,
});
```

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>Datacenter</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Provides a VMware vSphere datacenter resource. This can be used as the primary
container of inventory objects such as hosts and virtual machines.

#### Example Usage

##### Create datacenter on the root folder

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const prodDatacenter = new vsphere.Datacenter("prodDatacenter", {});
```

##### Create datacenter on a subfolder

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const researchDatacenter = new vsphere.Datacenter("researchDatacenter", {
    folder: "/research/",
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="DatastoreCluster" data-link-title="DatastoreCluster">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L68">
        Resource <strong>DatastoreCluster</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>DatastoreCluster</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..DatastoreCluster` resource can be used to create and manage
datastore clusters. This can be used to create groups of datastores with a
shared management interface, allowing for resource control and load balancing
through Storage DRS.

For more information on vSphere datastore clusters and Storage DRS, see [this
page][ref-vsphere-datastore-clusters].

[ref-vsphere-datastore-clusters]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-598DF695-107E-406B-9C95-0AF961FC227A.html

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** Storage DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const hosts = config.get("hosts") || [
    "esxi1",
    "esxi2",
    "esxi3",
];

const datacenter = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({ async: true }));
const esxiHosts: pulumi.Output<vsphere.GetHostResult>[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < hosts.length; i++) {
    esxiHosts.push(datacenter.apply(datacenter => vsphere.getHost({
        datacenterId: datacenter.id,
        name: hosts[i],
    }, { async: true })));
}
const datastoreCluster = new vsphere.DatastoreCluster("datastoreCluster", {
    datacenterId: datacenter.id,
    sdrsEnabled: true,
});
const datastore1 = new vsphere.NasDatastore("datastore1", {
    datastoreClusterId: datastoreCluster.id,
    hostSystemIds: esxiHosts.map(v => v.id),
    remoteHosts: ["nfs"],
    remotePath: "/export/test1",
    type: "NFS",
});
const datastore2 = new vsphere.NasDatastore("datastore2", {
    datastoreClusterId: datastoreCluster.id,
    hostSystemIds: esxiHosts.map(v => v.id),
    remoteHosts: ["nfs"],
    remotePath: "/export/test2",
    type: "NFS",
});
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/r/datastore_cluster.html.markdown.

cluster in.  This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the
datastore to.  Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of
`foo/bar`, The provider will place a datastore cluster named
`datastore-cluster-test` in a datastore folder located at
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/datastore-cluster-test`.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="DatastoreClusterVmAntiAffinityRule" data-link-title="DatastoreClusterVmAntiAffinityRule">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/datastoreClusterVmAntiAffinityRule.ts#L73">
        Resource <strong>DatastoreClusterVmAntiAffinityRule</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>DatastoreClusterVmAntiAffinityRule</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..DatastoreClusterVmAntiAffinityRule` resource can be used to
manage VM anti-affinity rules in a datastore cluster, either created by the
`vsphere..DatastoreCluster` resource or looked up
by the `vsphere..DatastoreCluster` data source.

This rule can be used to tell a set to virtual machines to run on different
datastores within a cluster, useful for preventing single points of failure in
application cluster scenarios. When configured, Storage DRS will make a best effort to
ensure that the virtual machines run on different datastores, or prevent any
operation that would keep that from happening, depending on the value of the
`mandatory` flag.

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** Storage DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const datastoreCluster = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getDatastoreCluster({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "datastore-cluster1",
}, { async: true }));
const cluster = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getComputeCluster({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "cluster1",
}, { async: true }));
const network = dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getNetwork({
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    name: "network1",
}, { async: true }));
const vm: vsphere.VirtualMachine[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
    vm.push(new vsphere.VirtualMachine(`vm-${i}`, {
        datastoreClusterId: datastoreCluster.id,
        disks: [{
            label: "disk0",
            size: 20,
        }],
        guestId: "other3xLinux64Guest",
        memory: 2048,
        networkInterfaces: [{
            networkId: network.id,
        }],
        numCpus: 2,
        resourcePoolId: cluster.resourcePoolId,
    }));
}
const clusterVmAntiAffinityRule = new vsphere.DatastoreClusterVmAntiAffinityRule("clusterVmAntiAffinityRule", {
    datastoreClusterId: datastoreCluster.id,
    virtualMachineIds: vm.map(v => v.id),
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="DistributedPortGroup" data-link-title="DistributedPortGroup">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/distributedPortGroup.ts#L125">
        Resource <strong>DistributedPortGroup</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>DistributedPortGroup</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..DistributedPortGroup` resource can be used to manage vSphere
distributed virtual port groups. These port groups are connected to distributed
virtual switches, which can be managed by the
`vsphere..DistributedVirtualSwitch` resource.

Distributed port groups can be used as networks for virtual machines, allowing
VMs to use the networking supplied by a distributed virtual switch (DVS), with
a set of policies that apply to that individual newtork, if desired.

For an overview on vSphere networking concepts, see [this
page][ref-vsphere-net-concepts]. For more information on vSphere DVS
portgroups, see [this page][ref-vsphere-dvportgroup].

[ref-vsphere-net-concepts]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.networking.doc/GUID-2B11DBB8-CB3C-4AFF-8885-EFEA0FC562F4.html
[ref-vsphere-dvportgroup]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.networking.doc/GUID-69933F6E-2442-46CF-AA17-1196CB9A0A09.html

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const esxiHosts = config.get("esxiHosts") || [
    "esxi1",
    "esxi2",
    "esxi3",
];
const networkInterfaces = config.get("networkInterfaces") || [
    "vmnic0",
    "vmnic1",
    "vmnic2",
    "vmnic3",
];

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const host: pulumi.Output<vsphere.GetHostResult>[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < esxiHosts.length; i++) {
    host.push(dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getHost({
        datacenterId: dc.id,
        name: esxiHosts[i],
    }, { async: true })));
}
const dvs = new vsphere.DistributedVirtualSwitch("dvs", {
    activeUplinks: [
        "uplink1",
        "uplink2",
    ],
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    hosts: [
        {
            devices: networkInterfaces,
            hostSystemId: host[0].id,
        },
        {
            devices: networkInterfaces,
            hostSystemId: host[1].id,
        },
        {
            devices: networkInterfaces,
            hostSystemId: host[2].id,
        },
    ],
    standbyUplinks: [
        "uplink3",
        "uplink4",
    ],
    uplinks: [
        "uplink1",
        "uplink2",
        "uplink3",
        "uplink4",
    ],
});
const pg = new vsphere.DistributedPortGroup("pg", {
    distributedVirtualSwitchUuid: dvs.id,
    vlanId: 1000,
});
```

##### Overriding DVS policies

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dvs = new vsphere.DistributedVirtualSwitch("dvs", {
    activeUplinks: ["tfup1"],
    datacenterId: vsphere_datacenter_dc.id,
    standbyUplinks: ["tfup2"],
    uplinks: [
        "tfup1",
        "tfup2",
    ],
});
const pg = new vsphere.DistributedPortGroup("pg", {
    activeUplinks: [
        "tfup1",
        "tfup2",
    ],
    distributedVirtualSwitchUuid: dvs.id,
    standbyUplinks: [],
    vlanId: 1000,
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="DistributedVirtualSwitch" data-link-title="DistributedVirtualSwitch">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/distributedVirtualSwitch.ts#L114">
        Resource <strong>DistributedVirtualSwitch</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>DistributedVirtualSwitch</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..DistributedVirtualSwitch` resource can be used to manage VMware
Distributed Virtual Switches.

An essential component of a distributed, scalable VMware datacenter, the
vSphere Distributed Virtual Switch (DVS) provides centralized management and
monitoring of the networking configuration of all the hosts that are associated
with the switch. In addition to adding port groups (see the
`vsphere..DistributedPortGroup` resource) that can
be used as networks for virtual machines, a DVS can be configured to perform
advanced high availability, traffic shaping, network monitoring, and more.

For an overview on vSphere networking concepts, see [this
page][ref-vsphere-net-concepts]. For more information on vSphere DVS, see [this
page][ref-vsphere-dvs].

[ref-vsphere-net-concepts]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.networking.doc/GUID-2B11DBB8-CB3C-4AFF-8885-EFEA0FC562F4.html
[ref-vsphere-dvs]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.networking.doc/GUID-375B45C7-684C-4C51-BA3C-70E48DFABF04.html

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const esxiHosts = config.get("esxiHosts") || [
    "esxi1",
    "esxi2",
    "esxi3",
];
const networkInterfaces = config.get("networkInterfaces") || [
    "vmnic0",
    "vmnic1",
    "vmnic2",
    "vmnic3",
];

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
}, { async: true }));
const host: pulumi.Output<vsphere.GetHostResult>[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < esxiHosts.length; i++) {
    host.push(dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getHost({
        datacenterId: dc.id,
        name: esxiHosts[i],
    }, { async: true })));
}
const dvs = new vsphere.DistributedVirtualSwitch("dvs", {
    activeUplinks: [
        "uplink1",
        "uplink2",
    ],
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    hosts: [
        {
            devices: networkInterfaces,
            hostSystemId: host[0].id,
        },
        {
            devices: networkInterfaces,
            hostSystemId: host[1].id,
        },
        {
            devices: networkInterfaces,
            hostSystemId: host[2].id,
        },
    ],
    standbyUplinks: [
        "uplink3",
        "uplink4",
    ],
    uplinks: [
        "uplink1",
        "uplink2",
        "uplink3",
        "uplink4",
    ],
});
```

##### Uplink name and count control

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const dvs = new vsphere.DistributedVirtualSwitch("dvs", {
    activeUplinks: ["tfup1"],
    datacenterId: vsphere_datacenter_dc.id,
    standbyUplinks: ["tfup2"],
    uplinks: [
        "tfup1",
        "tfup2",
    ],
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="DpmHostOverride" data-link-title="DpmHostOverride">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/dpmHostOverride.ts#L67">
        Resource <strong>DpmHostOverride</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>DpmHostOverride</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

The `vsphere..DpmHostOverride` resource can be used to add a DPM override to a
cluster for a particular host. This allows you to control the power management
settings for individual hosts in the cluster while leaving any unspecified ones
at the default power management settings.

For more information on DPM within vSphere clusters, see [this
page][ref-vsphere-cluster-dpm].

[ref-vsphere-cluster-dpm]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-5E5E349A-4644-4C9C-B434-1C0243EBDC80.html

> **NOTE:** This resource requires vCenter and is not available on direct ESXi
connections.

> **NOTE:** vSphere DRS requires a vSphere Enterprise Plus license.

#### Example Usage



```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const datacenter = config.get("datacenter") || "dc1";
const hosts = config.get("hosts") || [
    "esxi1",
    "esxi2",
    "esxi3",
];

const dc = pulumi.output(vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: datacenter,
}, { async: true }));
const hostsHost: pulumi.Output<vsphere.GetHostResult>[] = [];
for (let i = 0; i < hosts.length; i++) {
    hostsHost.push(dc.apply(dc => vsphere.getHost({
        datacenterId: dc.id,
        name: hosts[i],
    }, { async: true })));
}
const computeCluster = new vsphere.ComputeCluster("computeCluster", {
    datacenterId: dc.id,
    drsAutomationLevel: "fullyAutomated",
    drsEnabled: true,
    hostSystemIds: hostsHost.map(v => v.id),
});
const dpmHostOverride = new vsphere.DpmHostOverride("dpmHostOverride", {
    computeClusterId: computeCluster.id,
    dpmAutomationLevel: "automated",
    dpmEnabled: true,
    hostSystemId: hostsHost[0].id,
});
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/r/dpm_host_override.html.markdown.
