threshold of load within the cluster that influences host power operations.
This affects both power on and power off operations - a lower setting will
tolerate more of a surplus/deficit than a higher setting. Default: `3`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-drsAdvancedOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L653">property <b>drsAdvancedOptions</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>drsAdvancedOptions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;}&gt;;</code></pre>

A key/value map that specifies advanced
options for DRS and DPM.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-drsAutomationLevel">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L659">property <b>drsAutomationLevel</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>drsAutomationLevel?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The default automation level for all
virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `manual`,
`partiallyAutomated`, or `fullyAutomated`. Default: `manual`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-drsEnablePredictiveDrs">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L665">property <b>drsEnablePredictiveDrs</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>drsEnablePredictiveDrs?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

When `true`, enables DRS to use data
from [vRealize Operations Manager][ref-vsphere-vro] to make proactive DRS
recommendations. <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-drsEnableVmOverrides">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L670">property <b>drsEnableVmOverrides</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>drsEnableVmOverrides?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Allow individual DRS overrides to be
set for virtual machines in the cluster. Default: `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-drsEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L674">property <b>drsEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>drsEnabled?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable DRS for this cluster. Default: `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-drsMigrationThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L681">property <b>drsMigrationThreshold</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>drsMigrationThreshold?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A value between `1` and `5` indicating
the threshold of imbalance tolerated between hosts. A lower setting will
tolerate more imbalance while a higher setting will tolerate less. Default:
`3`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-folder">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L690">property <b>folder</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>folder?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The relative path to a folder to put this cluster in.
This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the cluster to.
Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of `foo/bar`,
The provider will place a cluster named `compute-cluster-test` in a
host folder located at `/dc1/host/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path
being `/dc1/host/foo/bar/datastore-cluster-test`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-forceEvacuateOnDestroy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L698">property <b>forceEvacuateOnDestroy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>forceEvacuateOnDestroy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

When destroying the resource, setting this to
`true` will auto-remove any hosts that are currently a member of the cluster,
as if they were removed by taking their entry out of `hostSystemIds` (see
below). This is an advanced
option and should only be used for testing. Default: `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L706">property <b>haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Defines the
managed object IDs of hosts to use as dedicated failover
hosts. These hosts are kept as available as possible - admission control will
block access to the host, and DRS will ignore the host when making
recommendations.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L714">property <b>haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum number
of failed hosts that admission control tolerates when making decisions on
whether to permit virtual machine operations. The maximum is one less than
the number of hosts in the cluster. Default: `1`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L721">property <b>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The percentage of
resource reduction that a cluster of virtual machines can tolerate in case of
a failover. A value of 0 produces warnings only, whereas a value of 100
disables the setting. Default: `100` (disabled).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L727">property <b>haAdmissionControlPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of admission control
policy to use with vSphere HA. Can be one of `resourcePercentage`,
`slotPolicy`, `failoverHosts`, or `disabled`. Default: `resourcePercentage`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L737">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Automatically determine available resource percentages by subtracting the
average number of host resources represented by the
`haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance`
setting from the total amount of resources in the cluster. Disable to supply
user-defined values. Default: `true`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L743">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of CPU resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L749">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of memory resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L754">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined CPU slot size, in MHz. Default: `32`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L759">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined memory slot size, in MB. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L766">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls
whether or not you wish to supply explicit values to CPU and memory slot
sizes. The default is `false`, which tells vSphere to gather a automatic
average based on all powered-on virtual machines currently in the cluster.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdvancedOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L771">property <b>haAdvancedOptions</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdvancedOptions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;}&gt;;</code></pre>

A key/value map that specifies advanced
options for vSphere HA.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L778">property <b>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take
on virtual machines if an APD status on an affected datastore clears in the
middle of an APD event. Can be one of `none` or `reset`. Default: `none`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L786">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected loss to all paths to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`,
`restartConservative`, or `restartAggressive`.  Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdResponseDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L793">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the delay in minutes
to wait after an APD timeout event to execute the response action defined in
`haDatastoreApdResponse`. Default: `3`
minutes. <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastorePdlResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L801">property <b>haDatastorePdlResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastorePdlResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected a permanent device loss to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`, or
`restartAggressive`. Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L806">property <b>haEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haEnabled?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable vSphere HA for this cluster. Default:
`false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastoreIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L813">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The list of managed object IDs for
preferred datastores to use for HA heartbeating. This setting is only useful
when `haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy` is set
to either `userSelectedDs` or `allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L820">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The selection policy for HA
heartbeat datastores. Can be one of `allFeasibleDs`, `userSelectedDs`, or
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`. Default:
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostIsolationResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L827">property <b>haHostIsolationResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHostIsolationResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The action to take on virtual
machines when a host has detected that it has been isolated from the rest of
the cluster. Can be one of `none`, `powerOff`, or `shutdown`. Default:
`none`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L833">property <b>haHostMonitoring</b></a>
</h4>

Global setting that controls whether
vSphere HA remediates virtual machines on host failure. Can be one of `enabled`
or `disabled`. Default: `enabled`.

Controls vSphere VM component
protection for virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `enabled` or
`disabled`. Default: `enabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmDependencyRestartCondition">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L850">property <b>haVmDependencyRestartCondition</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmDependencyRestartCondition?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The condition used to
determine whether or not virtual machines in a certain restart priority class
are online, allowing HA to move on to restarting virtual machines on the next
priority. Can be one of `none`, `poweredOn`, `guestHbStatusGreen`, or
`appHbStatusGreen`. The default is `none`, which means that a virtual machine
is considered ready immediately after a host is found to start it on.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmFailureInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L856">property <b>haVmFailureInterval</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmFailureInterval?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If a heartbeat from a virtual machine
is not received within this configured interval, the virtual machine is
marked as failed. The value is in seconds. Default: `30`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumFailureWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L865">property <b>haVmMaximumFailureWindow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumFailureWindow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The length of the reset window in
which `haVmMaximumResets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting
configured in `haVmMaximumResets`. `-1` means no window, meaning an
unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:
`-1` (no window).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumResets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L870">property <b>haVmMaximumResets</b></a>

The maximum number of resets that HA will
perform to a virtual machine when responding to a failure event. Default: `3`

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMinimumUptime">

The time, in seconds, that HA waits after
powering on a virtual machine before monitoring for heartbeats. Default:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L882">property <b>haVmMonitoring</b></a>

The type of virtual machine monitoring to use
when HA is enabled in the cluster. Can be one of `vmMonitoringDisabled`,
`vmMonitoringOnly`, or `vmAndAppMonitoring`. Default: `vmMonitoringDisabled`.

The default restart priority
for affected virtual machines when vSphere detects a host failure. Can be one
of `lowest`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `highest`. Default: `medium`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmRestartTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L901">property <b>haVmRestartTimeout</b></a>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-folder">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L493">property <b>folder</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>folder?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore
cluster in.  This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the
datastore to.  Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of
`foo/bar`, The provider will place a datastore cluster named
`datastore-cluster-test` in a datastore folder located at
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/datastore-cluster-test`.

this datastore cluster. Default: `true`.

in datastores in the cluster before storage DRS makes recommendations to
balance the load. Default: `5` percent.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L566">property <b>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The threshold of reservable
IOPS of all virtual machines on the datastore before storage DRS makes
recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore. Note that this setting should
only be set if `sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold` cannot make an accurate
estimate of the capacity of the datastores in your cluster, and should be set
to roughly 50-60% of the worst case peak performance of the backing LUNs.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold">

The threshold, in
percent, of actual estimated performance of the datastore (in IOPS) that
storage DRS uses to make recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore when
the total reservable IOPS exceeds the threshold. Default: `60` percent.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-sdrsIoReservableThresholdMode">

The reservable IOPS
threshold setting to use, `sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold` in the event
of `automatic`, or `sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold` in the event of
`manual`. Default: `automatic`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterState-folder">

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore
cluster in.  This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the
datastore to.  Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of

`datastore-cluster-test` in a datastore folder located at
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/datastore-cluster-test`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterState-sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L417">property <b>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The threshold of reservable
IOPS of all virtual machines on the datastore before storage DRS makes
recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore. Note that this setting should
only be set if `sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold` cannot make an accurate
estimate of the capacity of the datastores in your cluster, and should be set
to roughly 50-60% of the worst case peak performance of the backing LUNs.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterState-sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold">

The threshold, in
percent, of actual estimated performance of the datastore (in IOPS) that
storage DRS uses to make recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore when
the total reservable IOPS exceeds the threshold. Default: `60` percent.

The absolute path of the folder. For example, given a
default datacenter of `default-dc`, a folder of type `vm`, and a folder name
of `test-folder`, the resulting path would be

the path are: `vm`, `host`, `datacenter`, `datastore`, or `network`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="HaVmOverrideArgs-haVmMaximumFailureWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/haVmOverride.ts#L422">property <b>haVmMaximumFailureWindow</b></a>

The length of the reset window in
which `haVmMaximumResets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting
configured in `haVmMaximumResets`. `-1` means no window, meaning an
unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:

this resource are used for virtual machine monitoring. The default is `true`
(use cluster defaults) - set to `false` to have overrides take effect.

The length of the reset window in
which `haVmMaximumResets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="HostPortGroupState-vlanId">

Access mode for the mount point. Can be one of
`readOnly` or `readWrite`. Note that `readWrite` does not necessarily mean
that the datastore will be read-write depending on the permissions of the

ID of a datastore cluster to put this datastore in.
Conflicts with `folder`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="NasDatastoreArgs-folder">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/nasDatastore.ts#L392">property <b>folder</b></a>
</h4>

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore in.
This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the datastore to.
Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of `foo/bar`,
The provider will place a datastore named `test` in a datastore folder
located at `/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/test`. Conflicts with
`datastoreClusterId`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestIpTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1459">property <b>waitForGuestIpTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestIpTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available guest IP address on this virtual machine. This should
only be used if your version of VMware Tools does not allow the
`waitForGuestNetTimeout` waiter to be
used. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 0.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestNetRoutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1468">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `waitForGuestIpTimeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestNetTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1477">property <b>waitForGuestNetTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`waitForGuestIpTimeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-defaultIpAddress">

The IP address selected by the provider to be used with
any provisioners configured on this resource.
Whenever possible, this is the first IPv4 address that is reachable through
the default gateway configured on the machine, then the first reachable IPv6
address, and then the first general discovered address if neither exist. If
VMware tools is not running on the virtual machine, or if the VM is powered
off, this value will be blank.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-firmware">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-forcePowerOff">

The guest ID for the operating system type. For a
full list of possible values, see [here][vmware-docs-guest-ids]. Default: `other-64`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-guestIpAddresses">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L833">property <b>guestIpAddresses</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>guestIpAddresses?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-hardwareVersion">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L840">property <b>hardwareVersion</b></a>

The hardware version number. Valid range
is from 4 to 15. The hardware version cannot be downgraded. See [virtual
machine hardware compatibility][virtual-machine-hardware-compatibility] for

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-hostSystemId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L849">property <b>hostSystemId</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hostSystemId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

An optional managed object reference
ID of a host to put this virtual machine on. See the
section on virtual machine migration for
details on changing this value. If a `hostSystemId` is not supplied,
vSphere will select a host in the resource pool to place the virtual machine,
according to any defaults or DRS policies in place.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>hvMode?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The (non-nested) hardware virtualization setting for
this virtual machine. Can be one of `hvAuto`, `hvOn`, or `hvOff`. Default:

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-ignoredGuestIps">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L862">property <b>ignoredGuestIps</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>ignoredGuestIps?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

List of IP addresses and CIDR networks to
ignore while waiting for an available IP address using either of the waiters.
Any IP addresses in this list will be ignored if they show up so that the
waiter will continue to wait for a real IP address. Default: [].

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-imported">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L869">property <b>imported</b></a>

This is flagged if the virtual machine has been imported, or the
state has been migrated from a previous version of the resource. It
influences the behavior of the first post-import apply operation. See the
section on importing below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-latencySensitivity">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L877">property <b>latencySensitivity</b></a>

Controls the scheduling delay of the
virtual machine. Use a higher sensitivity for applications that require lower
latency, such as VOIP, media player applications, or applications that
require frequent access to mouse or keyboard devices. Can be one of `low`,
`normal`, `medium`, or `high`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-memory">

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L898">property <b>memoryReservation</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>memoryReservation?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of memory (in MB) that this
virtual machine is guaranteed. The default is no reservation.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-memoryShareCount">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L903">property <b>memoryShareCount</b></a>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestIpTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1077">property <b>waitForGuestIpTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestIpTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available guest IP address on this virtual machine. This should
only be used if your version of VMware Tools does not allow the
`waitForGuestNetTimeout` waiter to be
used. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 0.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestNetRoutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1086">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `waitForGuestIpTimeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestNetTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1095">property <b>waitForGuestNetTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`waitForGuestIpTimeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VmfsDatastoreArgs-folder">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/vmfsDatastore.ts#L364">property <b>folder</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>folder?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore in.
This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the datastore to.
Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of `foo/bar`,
The provider will place a datastore named `test` in a datastore folder
located at `/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/test`. Conflicts with
`datastoreClusterId`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VmfsDatastoreState-folder">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/7329c15dfcb65bdf36dc7a867a58c0303928ed5d/sdk/nodejs/vmfsDatastore.ts#L294">property <b>folder</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>folder?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore in.
This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the datastore to.
Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of `foo/bar`,
The provider will place a datastore named `test` in a datastore folder
located at `/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/test`. Conflicts with
`datastoreClusterId`.
